paper_metadata.title: Economic activities in disaster-prone areas are significantly susceptible to mountain disasters, and enhancing the resilience of new rural collective economies (RRCEs) is a pressing challenge that needs to be overcome in the areas of disaster risk management and sustainable development

program_information.target_population: Rural villages in disaster-prone mountainous areas

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The results show that (1) typical villages in the new rural collective economies (NRCE) have a low level of resilience. (2) Transformational capacity is the key to improving RRCEs.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: An assessment framework based on the Resilience Index Measurement Analysis (RIMA) model is established to evaluate the RRCEs in the face of mountain disasters

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: New rural collective economies are forms of rural public economic systems that are based on rural collective economic organizations.
evidence_citations.country_citation: Mountainous areas comprise approximately 20% of the total global land area, with China alone accounting for approximately two-thirds of this area
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The target research area comprises 48 representative villages in Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture (LP)
